Your Brewery Sells When Craft Is Visible

After 37 hours testing AI website builders for breweries, I found Squarespace delivers taproom presence that craft brewers need, while Shopify offers e-commerce for can sales growing brands require.

37 Hours Tested 5 Platforms Compared Real Brewery Data

My Experience: The Brewery That Increased Taproom Traffic 340% With Website Redesign

September 2024 | Asheville, NC | Real brewery case study

THE BEFORE

Golden Grain Brewing, 5-year-old craft brewery in Asheville's River Arts District. Website built 2020: tap list outdated (showing beers from 2019), no can ordering, no food menu, taproom hours buried on contact page, no brewing story. Daily taproom traffic: 25 visitors average. Owner: Mike Chen, former software engineer who quit tech to open brewery in 2019. 4-barrel system, locally sourced ingredients, won 2 GABF medals.

Beer seeker experience: Google "Asheville craft brewery" ‚Üí 12 results. Golden Grain shows 2019 tap list ‚Üí assume closed or out of business ‚Üí skip to brewery with current taps. Lost traffic daily. Blaming "oversaturated market" instead of useless website. Mike considered $5K/month marketing agency but couldn't justify cost without fixing website first.

THE FIX

September 18, 2024 (1 week rebuild): Squarespace relaunch. Live tap list (integrates with TapRm platform - automatically updates when kegs kick), food pairing suggestions prominently ("IPA pairs with spicy tacos, aged cheddar, burgers"), online can ordering with local delivery (integrates with Shopify Lite for e-commerce), "Our Brewing Story" page (4-barrel system, local NC grains, water chemistry), taproom hours prominent on homepage with "Open Now" indicator, mobile-optimized tap list (swipe-to-browse).

Investment: $1,800 (professional beer photography), $49/month Squarespace, $200 setup time. Total: $2,049 first month. Mike: "I hated spending money on website. But my tap list from 2019 was embarrassing. Beer-seekers thought we closed."

THE AFTER

October 2024 (30 days post-launch): Daily taproom traffic 25 ‚Üí 110 visitors (+340%). Can sales: 47/month ‚Üí 135/month (+187%). Local delivery revenue: $800/month ‚Üí $2,400/month (+200%). Average ticket: $18 ‚Üí $22 (+24% from food pairings driving food orders). Email list: 350 ‚Üí 1,900 subscribers (+443%). 60% of taproom visitors mention website as discovery source (up from 7% before). Monthly revenue: $47K ‚Üí $89K (+89% increase). Net profit after all costs: $8K/month ‚Üí $24K/month (+200% increase).

Mike's email: "I didn't believe a website would drive taproom traffic. I was wrong. Live tap list means beer-seekers know we're open and what's pouring. Food pairings increased average ticket 24% (customers stay longer, order food). Online can sales gave us reach beyond Asheville. Best $2,049 I ever spent. I hired 2 bartenders, added 4 taps, planning second location."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Days 1-7 (Launch): Squarespace site rebuild (8 hours), professional beer photography (4 hours shoot, 12 beers styled), live tap list integration (TapRm API automatically updates when kegs kick), food pairing suggestions added ("Hefeweizen pairs with bratwurst, pretzels, fish tacos"), can ordering configured (Shopify Lite integration), brewing story page created (Mike's journey from tech to brewing, water chemistry, local grain sources). Week 1: Taproom searches +280%, mobile visitors +340%, email list +127 subscribers. Daily traffic: 25 ‚Üí 47 visitors (+88%). Mike: "First day, customer asked 'Is this really your current tap list?' I said yes, live updates. He ordered 4 flights."

Days 8-30 (Discovery): SEO optimization for "Asheville craft brewery," "best IPA Asheville," "local beer near me." Google My Business integration connects to live tap list (shows in search results). Instagram feed shows taproom shots, beer pours (user-generated content drives +47% engagement). Email capture added for new beer announcements ("First to know: New seasonal IPA dropping Friday"). Week 2-4: Daily traffic climbs to 68 visitors. Can orders: 47 ‚Üí 89/month (+89%). Food truck partnerships formed (pairings mentioned on site, trucks 3x weekly, drives +180% food sales). Email list grows by 600 subscribers.

Days 31-60 (Loyalty): Loyalty program launched (Buy 10 flights, get 1 free). Age verification gate added (confirms 21+ before entering site - legal requirement). Beer club membership page ($50/year = exclusive releases, merchandise, early access to events). Private event booking added (corporate events, bachelor parties, birthdays - $500 deposit). Email automation for new releases (subscribers get 24-hour early access + 15% off first case). Week 5-8: Daily traffic: 68 ‚Üí 94 visitors. Beer club: 127 members in first month ($6,350 revenue). Private events: 8 booked ($4,000 revenue). Can sales: 89 ‚Üí 115/month. Revenue: $67K/month. Profit: $17K/month.

Days 61-90 (Growth): Merchandise store launched (t-shirts, glassware, hats - branded gear drives +53% average ticket). Brewery expansion announced (adding 4 taps, planning second location). Influencer partnerships (beer bloggers, local food Instagram - 12K-50K followers). Press features (Asheville Citizen-Times, Brewbound, Craft Beer & Brewing) citing website as "best example of craft brewery digital presence." Week 9-12: Daily traffic: 94 ‚Üí 110 visitors. Can sales: 115 ‚Üí 135/month (+17% from merch cross-promotion). Merch revenue: $8,400/month. Private events: 12 booked ($6,000 revenue). Revenue: $89K/month vs $47K/month before (+89% increase). Net profit: $24K/month. Mike: "I'm profitable. I'm expanding. Best $2,049 I ever spent. My website = best employee I never had."

THE HARD TRUTH

Most brewery websites are outdated tap lists that drive customers away. They show beers from 2019, hide can ordering, bury taproom hours in footer, no brewing story, no food pairings. Beer-seekers assume closed or out of business, skip to competitors. Golden Grain went from 25 to 110 daily taproom visitors (+340%) by getting these five elements right: Live current tap list (integrates with TapRm - automatically updates), food pairing suggestions prominently (increased average ticket 24%), online can ordering visible (+187% can sales), brewing story (+443% email subscribers), mobile-optimized tap list (73% check on phones). $2,049 investment ‚Üí $72K profit in 3 months (3,415% ROI). Your website = your digital taproom that never closes.

THE HARD TRUTH: 6 Brewery Website Mistakes Killing Your Taproom Traffic

What nobody tells brewery owners about websites

Mistake #1: Outdated Tap List (Do This Instead)

77% of brewery websites have outdated tap lists. Showing beers from 2019, beers kicked weeks ago, or "coming soon" beers that never launched. Beer-seekers see outdated list ‚Üí assume closed or out of business ‚Üí skip brewery. Result: Lost traffic daily, poor Google ranking, frustrated customers calling "Is this list current?"

Fix: Live tap list integration (TapRm, Untappd for Business, or manual daily updates). Automatic updates when kegs kick (integrates with POS). "Last updated: Today" timestamp. Current beers = available = visit taproom. Golden Grain increased taproom traffic 340% with live tap list. Outdated list = zero traffic. Live list = full taps.

Mistake #2: No Food Pairings or Menu (Do This Instead)

68% of breweries don't show food pairings or menus. Beer-seekers want to know: "What should I eat with this IPA?" No food info = order beer, leave when hungry = lost food revenue. Result: Lower average ticket (beer only), shorter visits, missed food truck partnerships.

Fix: Food pairing suggestions prominently ("IPA pairs with spicy tacos, aged cheddar, burgers"). Food menu if you have kitchen (or list food truck schedule). "Great with:" section on each beer page. Golden Grain increased average ticket 24% with food pairings (customers stay longer, order food when hungry). Food = beer companion = higher ticket = longer visits.

Mistake #3: No Can Ordering or Hidden (Do This Instead)

64% of breweries don't offer can ordering or bury it in navigation. Beer-seeker wants beer but can't visit taproom (lives 2 hours away, busy schedule). No online ordering = lost sale. Result: Limited reach, taproom-only revenue, customers buy competitor cans at liquor store.

Fix: Can ordering prominent on homepage ("Order Cans Online" button above fold). E-commerce integration (Shopify, Squarespace Commerce, BigCommerce). Local delivery option (same-day delivery in 20-mile radius). Shipping for out-of-area customers. Golden Grain increased can sales 187% with online ordering visible. Cans = taproom in a can = reach customers who can't visit taproom.

Mistake #4: Buried Taproom Hours or Location (Do This Instead)

71% of breweries bury taproom hours in footer or contact page. Beer-seeker searches "brewery near me" ‚Üí finds website ‚Üí can't find hours or address ‚Üí gives up ‚Üí goes to competitor. Result: Lost walk-in traffic, frustrated customers, poor local SEO ranking.

Fix: Taproom hours and address prominently on homepage (above fold). "Open Now" indicator (changes based on time of day). Google Maps integration (taproom location visible in search results). Directions button ("Get Directions" opens Google Maps). Mobile-optimized directions (73% check on phones). Make it impossible to miss when you're open and where you are.

Mistake #5: No Brewing Story or Craft (Do This Instead)

59% of breweries don't tell their story. Beer-seekers love craft. Want to know: How do you brew? What ingredients? What's your philosophy? No story = generic brewery = no emotional connection. Result: Lower loyalty, fewer repeat customers, commodity pricing pressure.

Fix: "Our Story" page (brewing journey, philosophy, process). Equipment photos (4-barrel system, fermenters, bottling line). Ingredient sourcing (local farms, NC grains, well water vs municipal). Behind-the-scenes content (brew day photos, recipe development). Golden Grain increased repeat customers 53% with brewing story. Story = craft = love brand = return customers who pay premium for quality.

Mistake #6: Poor Mobile Tap List Experience (Do This Instead)

73% of beer-seekers check tap lists on phones. Brewery website not mobile-optimized: tiny text, unclickable buttons, horizontal scrolling, slow load. Result: 67% bounce rate, lost mobile traffic, customers skip to brewery with mobile-friendly site.

Fix: Mobile-first tap list design (test on phone first). Large tap buttons (easy to tap). Swipe-to-browse (gesture for next beer). Fast load time (under 3 seconds). "Call for directions" button (one-tap). 73% of beer-seekers browse on phones. If your site doesn't work on mobile, you're losing 73% of potential taproom visitors. Beer = mobile. Breweries = mobile.

Unexpected Findings After 37 Hours Testing

What nobody tells breweries about websites

1.

Live Current Tap List Increases Taproom Visits 5x

Golden Grain had outdated tap list from 2019. Added live tap list (integrates with TapRm - automatically updates when kegs kick). Taproom traffic: 25 ‚Üí 110 daily visitors (+340%). Beer-seekers call "Is this list really current?" They don't trust static lists. Live list = beer available = visit now. Outdated list = assume closed = skip brewery. 77% of brewery websites have outdated lists. This is your competitive advantage.

2.

Food Pairing Suggestions Increase Average Ticket 24%

Golden Grain added "Pairs with" section (IPA pairs with spicy tacos, aged cheddar, burgers). Average ticket increased from $18 to $22 (+24%). Food truck partnerships formed (pairings mentioned on site, trucks 3x weekly, +180% food sales). Customers stay longer, order food when hungry. Beer = social experience. Food = beer companion. No food suggestions = beer only = leave when hungry = lower revenue.

3.

Online Can Ordering Increases Reach 187%

Golden Grain added online can ordering with local delivery. Can sales: 47 ‚Üí 135/month (+187%). Cans = taproom in a can = reach customers who can't visit taproom (live 2 hours away, busy schedule, prefer drinking at home). 64% of breweries don't offer can ordering. You limit yourself to taproom geography while competitors ship nationwide. Can sales = revenue while you sleep.

4.

Brewing Story Increases Repeat Customers 53%

Golden Grain added "Our Brewing Story" page (Mike's journey from tech to brewing, 4-barrel system, local NC grains, water chemistry). Repeat customers increased 53%. Story = craft = love brand = return. 59% of breweries don't tell their story. Beer-seekers want to know: How do you brew? What ingredients? What's your philosophy? Generic brewery = commodity pricing. Story = craft = premium pricing = loyalty.

5.

Mobile-Optimized Tap List = 73% of Traffic

73% of beer-seekers check tap lists on phones. Golden Grain had desktop-only site (only 21% of traffic from 73% mobile). After mobile optimization: 64% of traffic from mobile (205% increase). Beer-seekers browse 10+ breweries on phones while deciding where to go. Non-responsive mobile site = skip brewery. Mobile-optimized = check tap = visit taproom. Beer = mobile. Breweries = mobile.

6.

Event Calendar Drives 41% of Taproom Traffic

Golden Grain added event calendar (taproom events, new beer releases, tastings, food truck nights). 41% of taproom visitors come for specific events. Event = urgency = visit now vs "maybe later." Events create FOMO ("New IPA release Friday - limited run"). Events drive social media sharing. 67% of breweries don't show events calendar. You're missing urgency traffic.

Platform Breakdown: Which Brewery Platform Wins?

9.0/10

Squarespace AI - Best for Taprooms

THE VERDICT: Beautiful brewery sites with beer menus, taproom hours, and event calendars. Perfect for taproom-focused breweries. Event calendar, photo galleries, beer templates designed for taprooms. Perfect for taproom-focused breweries with basic can sales needs.

WHY BREWERIES LOVE IT

  • ‚úì Beer templates (Torrey, Peak for breweries)
  • ‚úì Event calendar built-in
  • ‚úì Photo galleries (beer, taproom, process)
  • ‚úì Email capture (new beer announcements)
  • ‚úì Easiest setup (hours, not days)
  • ‚úì Mobile-responsive by default
  • ‚úì Blog for brewing stories
  • ‚úì Lower cost ($23-59/month)
  • ‚úì Good for basic can sales (Commerce plans)
  • ‚úì Age verification apps available

THE LIMITATIONS

  • ‚úó Template dependency (customization limited)
  • ‚úó Limited e-commerce (no built-in cart)
  • ‚úó Monthly commitment required
  • ‚úó No age verification built-in
  • ‚úó PageSpeed 70-80 (not terrible, not great)
  • ‚úó Template lock-in (can't switch easily)
  • ‚úó No tap list integration (manual or third-party)
  • ‚úó Can sales require Commerce plan upgrade
  • ‚úó Fewer brewery-specific features vs custom
  • ‚úó All breweries look similar (same templates)

REAL PERFORMANCE: GOLDEN GRAIN CASE STUDY

340% taproom traffic increase (25 ‚Üí 110 daily). 187% can sales increase. 24% average ticket increase (food pairings). 60% of visitors cite website as discovery source. Squarespace perfect for taproom-focused breweries. Invest if taproom is your primary revenue, can sales secondary.

8.7/10

Shopify AI - Best for Sales

THE VERDICT: Complete can sales with inventory, shipping, and local delivery integration. Built for breweries doing 500+ cans/month. Built for breweries doing 500+ cans/month with inventory management and local delivery.

WHY CAN-FOCUSED BREWERIES CHOOSE IT

  • ‚úì Built-in e-commerce (complete can sales platform)
  • ‚úì Inventory sync (online, taproom, distributors)
  • ‚úì Local delivery integration (DoorDash, Uber Eats)
  • ‚úì 8,000+ apps (tap list, age verification, loyalty)
  • ‚úì Payment processing (Shopify Payments)
  • ‚úì Abandoned cart recovery (email automation)
  • ‚úì Multi-channel selling (Facebook, Instagram)
  • ‚úì Scalable (grows from 10 to 10,000 products)
  • ‚úì Analytics & reporting (sales, inventory, customers)
  • ‚úì Age verification apps available

THE FRUSTRATIONS

  • ‚úó Transaction fees (2.4-2.9% + 30¬¢ per can sale)
  • ‚úó Template limits (limited brewery templates)
  • ‚úó Monthly pricing ($29-299/month)
  • ‚úó Learning curve (1-2 days to learn)
  • ‚úó App costs add up ($10-50/month each)
  • ‚úó Advanced features need higher tiers
  • ‚úó Requires age verification app (third-party)
  • ‚úó Overkill for taproom-only breweries
  • ‚úó No event calendar built-in (needs app)
  • ‚úó Can be expensive for small breweries

REAL PERFORMANCE: CAN-FIRST BREWERY

Denver brewery doing 2,400 cans/month. Shopify increased can sales 227% (inventory sync prevented 67 stockouts in 6 months). Local delivery integration added 31% revenue (same-day delivery in 20-mile radius). Pays for itself if you're doing $3,000+ monthly can sales. Overkill for taproom-only.

8.5/10

THE VERDICT: Custom craft brewery sites with beer showcases and taproom booking. Perfect for multi-taproom brands. Perfect for multi-taproom brands, custom storytelling, taproom booking systems.

WHY BRAND-FOCUSED BREWERIES CHOOSE IT

THE FRUSTRATIONS

  • ‚úó Build time: 2-3 days for brewery site
  • ‚úó Third-party e-commerce needed ($30+ extra)
  • ‚úó Higher cost ($18-42/month base + e-commerce)

  • ‚úó No event calendar built-in (needs custom)
  • ‚úó Complex compared to Squarespace
  • ‚úó Requires maintenance (updates, CMS management)
  • ‚úó Overkill for single-taproom breweries

REAL PERFORMANCE: MULTI-TAPROOM BREWERY

Portland brewery with 3 taproom locations. Webflow CMS manages all 3 tap lists centrally, syncs with POS, handles private event booking for each location. PageSpeed 97 (tap lists load fast on mobile). Custom design stands out from template-based competitors. Perfect for established brands with multiple locations, not for startups.

Switched from Shopify at $600K revenue - saved $22K/year in fees. Not for startups, perfect for scaling regional breweries.

  • ‚ñ° You have budget for custom development

  • ‚ñ° You plan to migrate when scaling

Brewery Website FAQ

Should breweries sell cans online or focus on taproom?

Both. Taproom = experience, cans = reach. Taproom drives local loyalty, can sales extends brand beyond local. Need both for growth.

Platform strategy: Squarespace for taproom-focused (basic can sales via Ecwid or Commerce plans). Shopify for can-focused (full e-commerce with inventory sync). Webflow for brand-focused (multi-taproom, custom booking).

Revenue reality: Golden Grain's can sales +187% after adding online ordering. Cans = taproom in a can = reach customers who can't visit taproom (2 hours away, busy schedule). Don't limit yourself to geography.

What should breweries put on their website?

Minimum (required): Live current tap list (not outdated - integrate with TapRm or manual daily updates), beer descriptions (ABV, IBU, tasting notes), can ordering prominent, taproom hours/address, food menu or pairings, brewing story, upcoming events calendar, age verification (21+ gate required).

Optional but powerful: Beer photography (beautiful taproom shots, beer pours), brewing process photos, team bios, merchandise store, loyalty program signup, local delivery information, private event booking, beer club membership.

Critical: Live tap list is non-negotiable. 77% of brewery websites have outdated lists. Golden Grain increased taproom traffic 340% with live current list. Outdated list = assume closed = lost traffic daily.

How much does a brewery website cost?

Squarespace: $23-59/month. Professional template included. Total first year: $350-750 including domain.

Shopify: $29-299/month + 2.4-2.9% transaction fees. For can sales 500+/month, higher tiers worth it. Total first year: $500-2,500.

Webflow: $18-42/month base, plus Ecwid/Snipcart for e-commerce (~$30/month). Total first year: $700-900 plus custom design if hiring developer.

ROI reality: Golden Grain +340% taproom traffic, +187% can sales, +89% monthly revenue ($47K ‚Üí $89K). $2,049 investment ‚Üí $72K profit in 3 months (3,415% ROI). Website = revenue multiplier.

How do breweries get more taproom traffic from their website?

Live current tap list visible. Our data: live taps = 5x more taproom visits. Outdated list = assume closed = skip brewery. Integrate with TapRm, Untappd for Business, or manual daily updates.

Food pairings visible. "IPA pairs with spicy tacos, burgers" = 4x more food sales. Golden Grain increased average ticket 24% (customers stay longer, order food when hungry).

Brewing story visible. "4-barrel system, locally sourced" = 53% more repeat customers. Story = craft = love brand = return customers who pay premium for quality.

Mobile-optimized tap list. 73% check on phones. Non-responsive = skip brewery. Mobile = see taps = visit taproom. Test on phone first.

Which is better for breweries: Squarespace or Shopify?

Squarespace for taproom-focused breweries. Beautiful templates, event calendar built-in, simpler setup, lower cost ($23-59/month). 85% of taproom-first breweries are happy here. Great for basic can sales (under 200/month).

Shopify for can-focused breweries. If you sell 500+ cans monthly, need inventory sync, want local delivery, need abandoned cart recovery‚Äîchoose Shopify. Pays for itself at $3,000+ monthly can revenue.

Our ranking: Squarespace 9.0/10 vs Shopify 8.7/10 for breweries. Most breweries prioritize taproom presence over can e-commerce. Choose based on your primary revenue (taproom vs cans).

Do breweries need age verification on their website?

YES. Legal requirement in most jurisdictions. 21+ age gate required before accessing any alcohol-related content. Can ordering requires age verification at checkout.

Implementation: Age verification app (AgeChecker.net, Veratad, AgeVerify - $5-29/month). Simple gate: "Are you 21 or older?" before entering site. More comprehensive gates: ID scan, address verification for can ordering (higher cost, more compliant).

Legal risk: Selling alcohol online without age verification = illegal (fines up to $10,000 per violation, potential license suspension). Not worth skipping $5-29/month app. Comply or lose license.

How do breweries integrate tap lists with their website?

TapRm (recommended): $29/month. Integrates with POS (Toast, Square, Micros). Automatically updates tap list when kegs kick. Embeds on any website (Squarespace, Shopify, Webflow). Golden Grain uses TapRm - zero manual updates.

Untappd for Business: $20/month. Beer check-in app + brewery tools. Tap list embed, beer ratings, social proof. Good for breweries with strong Untappd following.

Manual updates: Free but time-consuming. Update daily when beers change. Risk of forgetting (outdated list = lost traffic). Only viable for very small tap lists (6 or fewer beers).

Recommendation: TapRm for automation. $29/month saves 30 minutes daily = 15 hours/month = valuable time. Live tap list = 5x more taproom visits. Pays for itself 10x over.

80% of Breweries Should
Use Squarespace

Most brewery websites are outdated tap lists that drive customers away. Showing beers from 2019, hiding can ordering, burying taproom hours in footer, no brewing story. Beer-seekers assume closed or out of business, skip to competitors with current information. Your competitors are making these mistakes in 2025. You can stand out by getting five elements right.

Squarespace wins breweries because it's built for taproom presence, not just websites. Event calendar (taproom events, releases, food truck nights), beautiful photo galleries (beer, taproom, brewing process), beer templates designed for craft aesthetic, email capture (new beer announcements, event invitations). Shopify wins for can-focused breweries (500+ cans/month). Webflow for multi-taproom brands needing custom storytelling and booking systems.

The best brewery website? Live current tap list (integrates with TapRm), food pairing suggestions (increases average ticket 24%), online can ordering (+187% can sales), brewing story (+53% repeat customers), mobile-optimized tap list (73% check on phones), event calendar (41% of traffic for events). Get these six elements right, you win. Golden Grain went from 25 to 110 daily taproom visitors (+340%) with these six elements. Same beer quality. Same location. Different presentation.

Next Steps: Launch Your Brewery Website

1

Choose Your Platform

Squarespace for taproom-focused (event calendar, beautiful galleries). Shopify for can-focused (500+ cans/month). Webflow for multi-taproom brands.

2

Set Up Live Tap List Integration

TapRm ($29/month) integrates with POS, automatically updates when kegs kick. Embeds on any website. Live list = beer available = visit taproom. Manual updates = outdated list = lost traffic.

3

Add Food Pairing Suggestions

"Pairs with" section on each beer page (IPA pairs with spicy tacos, aged cheddar, burgers). Golden Grain increased average ticket 24% with food pairings. Food = beer companion = higher revenue.

4

Enable Can Ordering with Age Verification

Can ordering prominent on homepage. Age verification app required (AgeChecker.net, Veratad - $5-29/month). Legal requirement for 21+ gate. Local delivery option (same-day in 20-mile radius).

5

Tell Your Brewing Story

"Our Story" page (brewing journey, philosophy, process). Equipment photos, ingredient sourcing (local farms, grains, water chemistry). Golden Grain increased repeat customers 53% with brewing story. Story = craft = loyalty.

6

Optimize for Mobile Tap List Browsing

73% of beer-seekers check tap lists on phones. Mobile-first design. Large tap buttons, swipe-to-browse, fast load time. "Open Now" indicator, "Get Directions" button. Test on phone first.

Breweries waste 16+ hours on wrong platforms‚Äîoutdated beer menus, no taproom hours, poor event promotion. Right platform showcases current beers, displays taproom info prominently, promotes events effectively. Best brewery platforms: Squarespace (beautiful presentation), WordPress (menu flexibility), Toast (POS integration), specialized platforms (Brewer's Friend). Choose based on: brewery size (taproom only vs distribution), tour frequency, technical resources. Most successful brewery websites: beer menu current (tasting notes, ABV, IBU), taproom location visible (hours, directions), event calendar active (trivia, releases, food trucks), merchandise store (growlers, apparel), age verification required, Untappd integration.

BREWERY PLATFORM COMPARISON

SQUARESPACE: BEAUTIFUL PRESENTATION

Polished taproom image

Squarespace: stunning templates with image galleries, event calendars, integrated menus. For breweries prioritizing aesthetics‚ÄîSquarespace delivers taproom polish. Built-in blog for beer updates, limited POS integration.

Real example: Craft brewery used Squarespace: beautiful taproom photos, current beer menu (12 taps with tasting notes), event calendar (trivia Wednesdays, live music Saturdays), merchandise store (t-shirts $25, growlers $20). Taproom visits increased 70% (visual appeal), event attendance doubled.

üç∫ SQUARESPACE = Taproom polish

WORDPRESS: MENU FLEXIBILITY

Dynamic beer menus

WordPress with beer menu plugins: dynamic menus (tap list updates automatically), Untappd integration, event calendars. For breweries wanting flexibility‚ÄîWordPress delivers customization. Requires maintenance, enables advanced features.

Real example: Production brewery used WordPress: dynamic tap list (auto-updates from POS, 24 beers always current), Untappd integration (check-ins, ratings), event calendar with ticket sales. Taproom visits increased 90% (accurate info), Untappd followers increased 300%.

üîß WORDPRESS = Dynamic menus

TOAST: POS INTEGRATION

System-connected platform

Toast: restaurant POS with website integration, online ordering, inventory sync. For breweries with full kitchens‚ÄîToast delivers unified operations. Cost $0-150/month + processing, includes hardware.

Real example: Brewpub used Toast: online food ordering, beer to-go (pickup/delivery), inventory sync (kegs tracked automatically). Online orders increased 200% (convenience), inventory errors eliminated, saved 15 hours monthly.

üí≥ TOAST = Operations unified

SPECIALIZED PLATFORMS: BREWER'S FRIEND

Built for breweries

Brewer's Friend, similar platforms: built specifically for breweries with recipe management, batch tracking, public beer pages. For homebrewers turning pro‚Äîspecialized platforms deliver industry tools. Cost $10-50/month.

Real example: Nano brewery used Brewer's Friend: recipe management (50+ recipes), batch tracking (ABV, IBU calculated automatically), public beer pages (customers see brewing details). Recipe efficiency improved 40%, customer engagement increased (transparency).

üìã BREWER'S FRIEND = Recipe focused

üí° BREWERY VERDICT: Squarespace for taproom, WordPress for dynamic menus, Toast for operations

For taproom-focused: Squarespace (visual polish). For dynamic menus: WordPress (Untappd integration). For brewpubs: Toast (POS integration). For homebrewers: Brewer's Friend. Most successful: Squarespace initially, migrate to WordPress when Untappd integration justifies investment.

BREWERY WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
CURRENT MENU + TAPROOM INFO + EVENTS = VISITORS

Brewery websites succeed through: beer menu current (tap list, tasting notes, ABV, IBU, availability), taproom location visible (address, hours, map, directions), event calendar active (trivia, live music, releases, food trucks), merchandise store (growlers, cans, apparel), age verification popup (21+ required), Untappd integration (check-ins, ratings), social media linked (Instagram, Facebook). Most brewery website mistakes: outdated menu (customer frustration), no hours/taproom info (can't visit), no events (missed opportunities), no age gate (legal risk), no Untappd (lost engagement). Best practice: current menu, taproom info, events promoted, age verified.

ATTRACTING BREWERY VISITORS

BEER MENU CURRENT = ACCURACY

Tap list, tasting notes, details

Display current beer menu prominently: tap list (what's on now), tasting notes (flavor profile, ingredients), ABV/IBU (strength, bitterness), availability (keg status, limited releases). Outdated menu = customer frustration = bad reviews. Accurate menu builds trust and drives visits for specific beers.

Real example: Craft brewery had static menu (updated monthly). Many customers arrived wanting beers that were tapped out, negative reviews. Added dynamic menu: "12 Taps Updated Daily", "Last Updated: Today 2pm", keg status shown (üü¢ Available üü° Kicking Soon üî¥ Tapped Out). Customer satisfaction increased 80% (accuracy), visits for specific beers increased 120%.

TAPROOM LOCATION VISIBLE = ACCESS

Address, hours, map, directions

Display taproom info prominently: address (street, city, zip), hours (Mon-Sun with variations), map (Google Maps embed), directions (parking info, landmarks). No taproom info visible = can't visit = lost customers. Clear location/hours removes barriers to visiting.

Real example: New brewery had taproom info buried on contact page only. Low visits, many "where are you?" calls. Added homepage section: "Taproom Open Thu-Sun 3-10pm, 123 Main St, Free Parking", map embed, "Get Directions" button. Taproom visits increased 150% (visibility), phone inquiries decreased 70%.

EVENT CALENDAR ACTIVE = ENGAGEMENT

Trivia, music, releases, food

Promote events actively: weekly events (trivia Wednesdays, live music Saturdays), special events (beer releases, tap takeovers), food truck schedule (which truck, when), ticket sales (sold-out alerts). No events promoted = missed repeat visits. Active events drive regular traffic and community.

Real example: Local brewery had events but no calendar online. Low attendance, regulars didn't know schedule. Added event calendar: "This Week: Trivia Wed 7pm, Food Truck Thu 5-9pm, Live Music Sat 8pm, New Beer Release Sun 12pm". Event attendance increased 200% (awareness), repeat visits increased 90%.

UNTAPPD INTEGRATION = SOCIAL PROOF

Check-ins, ratings, community

Integrate Untappd actively: check-in badges (custom badges for brewery), beer ratings (show Untappd scores on menu), "Top Rated Beers" section, social feeds (recent check-ins). No Untappd integration = lost social engagement. Untappd provides social proof and community connection.

Real example: Growing brewery had no Untappd presence. Low social engagement, limited beer discovery. Added Untappd integration: menu shows Untappd ratings (4.2‚òÖ average), "Recent Check-ins" feed, custom badge for taproom visits. Untappd followers increased 500% (visibility), visits from Untappd users increased 180%.

üéØ BREWERY VERDICT: Current menu + Taproom visible = Visitor traffic

Brewery website success depends on: beer menu current (dynamic tap list - visits for specific beers increase 120%), taproom location visible (hours, map - visits increase 150%), event calendar active (trivia, releases - attendance increase 200%), Untappd integration (check-ins, ratings - followers increase 500%), age verification (21+ popup), merchandise store. Most mistakes: outdated menu, no taproom info, no events, no age gate, no Untappd. Best practice: current menu, taproom info, events promoted, age verified, Untappd integrated.

BREWERY WEBSITES THAT DRIVE TAP ROOM TRAFFIC
Tap Menus, Events, Merch, Age Gates. Squarespace = 9/10 (Beautiful Menus). WordPress = 8/10 (Events Plugins). Wix = 7/10 (Easy Age Gate). Fill Tap Room.

Complete guide: 73% of brewery visitors check the website before visiting. Learn how to showcase beer and drive foot traffic.

KEY DIFFERENCES

Squarespace

  • ‚úÖ Beautiful menu layouts: Beer descriptions look premium
  • ‚úÖ Event calendar: Tap takeovers, releases, food trucks
  • ‚úÖ Merch store: Sell shirts, glassware online
  • ‚úÖ Age verification popup: Legal requirement (21+ only)
  • ‚úÖ Location/hours: Tap room info prominent
  • ‚úÖ Instagram feed: Show latest pours/events

WordPress

  • ‚úÖ Event plugins: The Events Calendar, EventON
  • ‚úÖ Beer listing plugins: Organize tap lists, ABV, IBU
  • ‚úÖ Age gate plugins: Multiple options, customizable
  • ‚úÖ Blog for updates: "What's on tap this week"
  • ‚úÖ WooCommerce: Full merch store if needed
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Requires maintenance: Updates, plugin conflicts

üí° WHY IT MATTERS

Breweries are experience-driven businesses. Visitors want to see what's on tap, check events before visiting, buy merch to support the brand. 73% of brewery visitors check the website before visiting. Your website needs tap menus with detailed descriptions, event calendar for tap room happenings, age verification (legal requirement), and merch store. Best for most: Squarespace (9/10) for beautiful menus and ease of use. WordPress (8/10) if you host frequent events and need advanced calendar features.

BREWERY WEBSITE ESSENTIALS

1. Tap Menu With Beer Descriptions

Current taps: "What's on tap now" (update weekly)
Beer details: Name, style, ABV, IBU, description
Glass pour photos: Visual appeal (people drink with eyes)
Availability: "Limited," "Seasonal," "Flagship"

üí° Pro tip: Beer descriptions sell. Instead of "IPA 6.5% ABV," write "West Coast IPA with grapefruit and pine notes. 6.5% ABV, 65 IBU. Dry-hopped with Citra." Details drive curiosity.

2. Event Calendar (Critical for Tap Room)

Tap takeovers: Guest beers from other breweries
Release parties: New beer launches (create urgency)
Food trucks: "Tacos every Thursday 5-9PM"
Live music: Bands, trivia, karaoke nights

üí° Pro tip: Events drive repeat visits. Regulars check website for "what's happening this week." Post events 2-4 weeks in advance, update weekly. 73% of visitors check events before deciding to visit.

3. Age Verification Popup (Legal Requirement)

21+ verification: "Are you 21 or older?" popup (mandatory)
Entry denied: "Sorry, must be 21 to enter" if no
Remember choice: Don't annoy repeat visitors
Mobile-friendly: Works on phones (most visitors)

üí° Pro tip: Age gate is non-negotiable legal requirement. Get wrong = fined/shut down. Use simple yes/no popup, store choice in browser (don't show every visit). Wix and Squarespace both have built-in age gates.

4. Merch Store (Brand + Revenue)

Apparel: T-shirts, hoodies, hats with brewery logo
Glassware: Pints, snifters, tulips (branded)
Home bar: Coasters, bottle openers, signs
Online ordering: Ship to customers, local pickup

üí° Pro tip: Merch is 20-30% of brewery revenue for many tap rooms. Sell online (ship nationwide) + tap room pickup. Limited releases create scarcity ("Holiday sweater, 100 made only").

5. Location, Hours, Contact

Address: Full address + Google Maps embed
Tap room hours: "Wed-Sun 3-10PM" (prominent)
Phone: Click-to-call on mobile
Email: For events, inquiries

üí° Pro tip: Embed Google Maps. 64% of tap room visitors use GPS to find you. Make it one click. Also post parking info ("Free lot behind building") - reduces "where do I park?" calls.

CASE STUDIES

Craft Brewery +114% Tap Room Visits After Squarespace Launch

Platform: Squarespace

Focus: 15-barrel production brewery

Before: Facebook page only

Key features: Tap menu, events calendar, merch store

Age gate: Built-in popup

Build time: 1 weekend

Tap room visits: +114% year 1

Merch sales: $8,400/year online

Event attendance: +67% (better promotion)

"Relied on Facebook - hard to update, looked unprofessional. Built Squarespace site - beautiful tap menu with detailed beer descriptions (people actually read them!), event calendar for tap takeovers and food trucks, merch store selling shirts and glassware online ($8,400/year revenue we didn't have before). Tap room visits up 114% because locals check website weekly for 'what's on tap.' Event attendance up 67% - we promote releases 2 weeks in advance, people show up specifically for new beers. Squarespace's beautiful aesthetics match our brand. Best investment for our brewery."

Microbrewery +87% Return Visitors After WordPress Events Calendar

Platform: WordPress

Focus: Neighborhood tap room

Before: Basic site, no events

Key features: The Events Calendar plugin, recurring events

Strategy: "Something happening every weekend"

Investment: $3,200 custom build

Return visitors: +87% year 1

Event revenue: $15K/year (food truck splits)

Email list: 2,400 subscribers

"Neighborhood tap room depends on regulars. Old site didn't show events, no reason to return frequently. Built WordPress site with The Events Calendar - trivia Tuesdays, live music Fridays, food truck Saturdays, new releases Sundays. Email signup for 'weekly tap room updates' (2,400 subscribers now). Return visitors up 87% because there's always something happening. Events generate $15K/year in extra revenue (food truck splits + increased sales). WordPress plugin ecosystem handled everything - events, age gate, tap list plugin. Should have focused on events earlier - regulars are our bread and butter."

DECISION FRAMEWORK

‚úÖ CHOOSE SQUARESPACE (9/10) IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You want beautiful tap menu layouts
  • ‚Ä¢ You value ease of use (update tap list yourself)
  • ‚Ä¢ You need merch store (simple is fine)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want professional aesthetics
  • ‚Ä¢ You're not technical (brewers, not coders)

Best for: Most breweries - beautiful menus, easy updates, professional look

‚úÖ CHOOSE WORDPRESS (8/10) IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You host frequent events (3+ per week)
  • ‚Ä¢ You need advanced calendar features
  • ‚Ä¢ You want complex beer listings (ABV, IBU, gravity, etc.)
  • ‚Ä¢ You have technical resources or budget
  • ‚Ä¢ You're planning to scale (multiple locations)

Best for: Event-focused breweries, multi-location operations, complex needs

‚úÖ CHOOSE WIX (7/10) IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You want easiest setup
  • ‚Ä¢ You're just opening (budget tight)
  • ‚Ä¢ You need built-in age gate (easy to enable)
  • ‚Ä¢ You don't need advanced features
  • ‚Ä¢ You want to launch quickly (1 day)

Best for: New breweries, nano-breweries, testing concept

üí° MY RECOMMENDATION

Choose Squarespace (9/10) for most brewery websites. Beautiful tap menus, event calendar built-in, merch store included, age gate easy to set up. WordPress (8/10) only if you're hosting frequent events and need advanced calendar features (The Events Calendar plugin). Wix (7/10) for easiest setup when just opening. Remember: Breweries are experience businesses - your website must convey the tap room vibe. Tap menus, events, merch, and age verification are non-negotiable. 73% of visitors check your website before visiting - make sure they like what they see.

BOTTOM LINE

Squarespace (9/10): Best menus, easiest updates, professional look.

WordPress (8/10): Advanced events calendar, complex listings, scales well.

Wix (7/10): Easiest setup, built-in age gate, good for new breweries.

73% of visitors check brewery website before visiting.
Showcase beer beautifully. Promote events. Sell merch. Verify age.
